title: De Quervain's Tenosynovitis Treatment
content: De Quervain's tenosynovitis involves inflammation of tendons on the thumb side of the wrist. Conservative management includes thumb spica splinting, NSAIDs, and activity modification. Corticosteroid injection into the tendon sheath is highly effective, with approximately 80% of patients experiencing resolution after a single injection. Surgical release of the first dorsal compartment is reserved for refractory cases.
